content: c o p p e r s c a l e d r a g o n - < p a t t e r n n a m e > try-angles by copperscaledragon jane spaulding ©2008 materials yarn any - i used baby bee sweet delights for this one hook - whatever gives you the look you want for your project i used an e or 3 5mm for this block tapestry needle to weave ends us stitch guide st = stitch slip_stitch = slip_stitch chain = chain single_crochet = single_crochet double_crochet = double_crochet treble_crochet = treble_crochet skip x = skip x number of stitches 2008 copperscaledragon page 1 of 5 published <date> c o p p e r s c a l e d r a g o n - < p a t t e r n n a m e > gauge gauge for this project will be determined by the yarn hook combination you chose this is such a simple little pattern yet you can do amazing things with it depending on how you put the pieces together you can build many shapes from a basic triangle so i am really excited to see what you come up with this pattern starts out with a chain 4 then work 11 double_crochet stitches into the 4th chain from the hook join with a slip_stitch to the top chain of the chain 4 to form a circle r 1 *chain 5 skip next st treble_crochet in next st chain 5 * repeat 2 more times for a total of three sections around the center r 2 if this is your first motif or it is not joining to another piece of your project you will work as follows *work 7 single_crochet in the next chain 5 space chain 3 skip treble_crochet 7 single_crochet in next chain 5 space* repeat 2 more times to complete motif fasten_off 2008 copperscaledragon page 2 of 5 published <date> c o p p e r s c a l e d r a g o n - < p a t t e r n n a m e > if you are joining to another piece work as follows work 7 single_crochet in next chain 5 space chain 1 put the two pieces together with the right sides facing in and work a slip_stitch into the chain 3 loop piece to be joined through the point pieces with right sides facing in ready for chain 1 working in the next chain 5 space chain 1 7 single_crochet in next chain 5 space repeat around to finish either as a join or a chain 3 loop as needed fasten_off completed join this join is called join as you go 2008 copperscaledragon page 3 of 5 published <date> c o p p e r s c a l e d r a g o n -
